medical_history.chief_complaint: Fever and rapid deterioration of vision in the left eye.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until six weeks prior, when he developed fevers, sweats, myalgias, and right-sided pleuritic chest pain. Three days later, pneumonia was diagnosed via chest radiograph. After a transient improvement from azithromycin, symptoms worsened after treatment ended, including fevers and malaise. Two days prior to admission, he noticed a 'brown spot' in the left visual field that enlarged until he could see only hand motions with that eye.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diabetes mellitus type 2, managed with metformin hydrochloride.
medical_history.social_history: The patient drank little alcohol, used no tobacco, and did not have a history of illicit drug use. He worked as a cook and had not traveled outside of the United States for six years.
